intro: Chenopodium hypsophilum, commonly known as silverleaf goosefoot, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cup-shaped inflorescences, and it produces small, round seeds. Chenopodium hypsophilum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
